TopicTitle: VAB/SPH: move the Crew button next to Launch button

Articles.Content:
Many people - including me - often get confused by the Crew button placement next to Parts and Action Groups buttons. These buttons are used to set up ship properties which are saved with the ship, while the Crew button only works till the next change on the ship.

Also when going to launch the ship, it is easy to forget that the crew needs to be set because of the distance between the Launch and the Crew buttons.

Therefore I suggest to place the Crew button right beside the Launch button and change the behavior of the menu so that the corresponding pane slides out from the other side.

Below you can see a crude preview how it could look like (excuse my image editing skills). It is mostly cosmetic change but I believe it would make things easier for many players.

I actually like it where it is and think that including it in the other button cluster will be even more confusing because it will obfuscate the feature.

I'm with Kasuha on this, although another fix could be that if you do put crew in the ship, that change is permanent until the ship is launched. It's very frustrating setting up your lab with 2 kerbals, only to fly it up and realise it has noone in it because you added another antenna.

I actually like it where it is and think that including it in the other button cluster will be even more confusing because it will obfuscate the feature.

I'm not sure what kind of obfuscation do you mean. As long as the crew setup is only semipermanent and you need to do it as the last thing before the launch anyway, the idea is to have two launch buttons, one "set up crew and launch" and the other "quicklaunch". And this rearrangement is all it actually takes.

Just by the button being there you're more likely to remember that you wanted to set up the crew before the launch.

I'm not sure what kind of obfuscation do you mean.

There are two kinds of obfuscation that I see here. The first is of the "lost in a sea of buttons" sort since the right hand side of the screen is already pretty cluttered. (this is less of a problem than I thought, I inflated it in my mind because the crew button just didn't look "right" on the right hand side) The second is of the "one of these things is not like the other" sort.

The second sort is the one I take issue with. All three of the buttons on the left hand side of the screen deal with the craft directly as a game object while the ones on the right are mainly file operations except for the launch and exit buttons which deal with game state changes. I think the exit button works as-is because exit buttons are traditionally clustered with file operations buttons. The flag button is a sort of "odd man out" but at least it's grouped with the craft name, which is in a good, prominent position. Given that, I think a better solution would be to move the launch button to the left hand cluster of buttons because, while it may be a "game state" button, it deals with the rocket directly as a game object.

Just by the button being there you're more likely to remember that you wanted to set up the crew before the launch.

I could make the same case for the action groups button which I forget far more often than crew because I'm always trying to get Jeb out of the cockpit (damned default crew...)

Crew and Launch buttons are however involved in mission arrangement, not in the ship design. That's why I'm putting them together and separate from - the two, initially, but actually all five ship design buttons.

That's matter of opinion, I guess. For starters, crew selection is not saved together with the ship.

It's a matter of how we conceptualize these things, really. You are thinking in terms of ship/mission while I am thinking in terms of file/game object/game state. The problem I find with your original groupings is that they go against traditional UI design and how controls are clustered on the screen; it's not really that intuitive. Most, if not all, users are familiar with "file" operations being clustered into a menu with an exit button, hence my preference for moving the launch button away from them rather than adding yet another button to that cluster.

I don't think I would have problems if the menu looked like this:

http://i.imgur.com/X8cUrcg.png

It's a much better layout but I assure you that "new" button is going to get mighty annoying mighty fast... I would still prefer moving the launch button into the cluster with the three craft-specific buttons and leaving the rest of the layout the same. This would also keep the "new" button on the edge of the cluster rather than somewhere in the center.

The transient nature of the crew selection is one area that should be addressed anyway (and would likely clear up this issue), especially if the specified crew are still available after revert (since I'm assuming that this is mainly used during testing/adjusting).

hence my preference for moving the launch button away from them rather than adding yet another button to that cluster.

I'd have no issues with that. The matter of the suggestion is to put Crew and Launch buttons together and that does not contradict with placing the Launch button somewhere else.

However I think the standard approach is:

(design phase)

1/ start new ship/load existing ship

2/ refine the design

3/ save the result

(mission phase)

4/ set up the crew

5/ launch

And my initial suggestion has only new/load (step 1) buttons "out of line" of this stream, the rest is organized left to right. And honestly if I should choose between "traditional design" and design which doesn't confuse users, I'm all for the latter.

In retrospect and with your comment that the New button would get in the way, I think the initial suggestion is better. Because there's also good reason why the Save button is right next to the Launch button/group.
